_comment: Created by EFisher on 24/01/2014 16:53:47 using v2.0
title: How has the proportion of women screened changed?
analysis_commentary: The coverage of breast cancer screening for eligible women increased from 64% in 2002 to around 77.0% since 2009 and has been more or less stable for the past few years. Cervical cancer screening coverage, however, has been more variable. Coverage was steadily declining until 2008, when rates rose from 72.5% to a high of 75.5% in 2010. In 2008-09, Jade Goody, a TV celebrity, died an early death from cervical cancer. This led to an increase in awareness of cervical cancer screening by women, which may be responsible for the increase seen at that time.
data_source: Health & Social Care Information Centre, breast screening programme and cervical screening programme
